title: Implement epic picker with ticks-style UI
description:
Implement epic selection picker (separate from main TUI):

EpicInfo struct:
type EpicInfo struct {
    ID       string
    Title    string
    Priority int
    Tasks    int // task count
}

Picker model:
type Picker struct {
    epics    []EpicInfo
    selected int
    chosen   *EpicInfo // nil until selection confirmed
    quitting bool
    width    int
    height   int
}

Implement tea.Model interface:
- Init(): return nil
- Update(): handle j/k navigation, enter to select, q to quit
- View(): render list with selection

View layout:
┌─ Select Epic ────────────────────────┐
│                                      │
│   > [abc] P1 Epic Title (5 tasks)    │
│     [def] P2 Another Epic (3 tasks)  │
│     [ghi] P3 Third Epic (8 tasks)    │
│                                      │
│   j/k: navigate  enter: select  q: quit
└──────────────────────────────────────┘

Styling:
- Selected: blue bold with > cursor
- Unselected: dim lavender
- Priority colored (P1 red, P2 orange, P3 green)
- Task count in parentheses

Export NewPicker(epics []EpicInfo) Picker
Export Selected() *EpicInfo method
closed_reason: Epic picker already implemented by iteration 13o. Verified complete implementation: EpicInfo struct, Picker model with Init/Update/View (tea.Model interface), NewPicker constructor, Selected() method. Styling uses Catppuccin colors - selected items blue+bold with ▶ cursor, priority P1/P2/P3 colored red/orange/green, task counts in dim style. Navigation supports j/k/g/G/enter/q/esc. Build and tests pass.
